Header: Six killed as typhoon Mitag sweeps parts of South Korea
Content: Six people were killed when typhoon Mitag passed through the country on Thursday. Mitag, the 18th typhoon this year, brought heavy rains in southern parts of the country. Some of the six were underneath collapsed structures and others drowned. More than 100 houses and other private structures were flooded, with more than 1,500 evacuating their homes in advance in the southeast regions. Some 44,045 houses and buildings had lost power between, of which 83% have regained electricity.
